statement.p: Recall that the lift equation is \displaystyle{L}=\frac{{1}}{{2}}\rho{s}{C}_{{L}}{v}^{{2}}.
Suppose \displaystyle\rho={0.001516}, \displaystyle{s}={174}, and \displaystyle{C}_{{L}}={1.59}. How much does the lift increase if velocity is increased from 59.2 nm/hr to 81.8 nm/hr?

solution.p: The velocity units are in nautical miles per hour which does not match the other units. First, we need to convert.
Now we can use the lift equation
Thus an increase in 22.6 nm/hr results in an increase of \displaystyle{3997.170876097}-{2093.5798057168}={1903.5910703802}\approx{1900} lbs.
